page.title: 11BOWHOUSE FARM : FEEDING
page.content: FEEDING THE DAIRY COWS From{March to October}the cows graze out of doors on the pastures. However, as Autumn approaches the cows are fed a diet consisting of cattlecake, brewsed barley, and pea straw which is high in protein. This prepares the animals for the winter months. {Over the winter,}the cows are housed in cubicles inside a barn and are fed a diet of potatoes, silage, straw, brewsed barley and cattlecake. The controlled feeding of the cows over the winter has the advantage of the farmer knowing exactly how much food the cows have been fed and this leads to an increased and regular production of milk. Over the summer months, when the cows are grazing freely on the pastures, milk output is irregular as it depends on the amount of grass eaten by the cows.
